entry.title: Re: Hyper-V virtualization is not supported for SAP syste...
entry.content: Hi..We also have Windows OS (2022) and HyperVisor (free) hosting dev/a/sand boxes and prod on failover clustering. The only issue we saw was in our prod failover cluster, if the SUSE moves to another host and back to the original host the hardware key on SAP changes and we have to apply license again. This hardware key change does not happen for live migrations but only if application is stopped and started.

entry.title: Re: How to handle different fiscal year variants and fixe...
entry.content:
HI @yahaha ,

-Different fiscal year variants â†’ must use separate company codes and separate controlling areas.
-Fixed asset depreciation operates independently per company code, so January recalculation in Company B will never affect Company A.
-Maintain consistent depreciation area structure, but allow local GAAP differences per CoCd.
-Use Group Reporting to consolidate results across both fiscal years.

 

Topic / AreaCompany A (Japan)Company B (China)SAP Rule / BehaviorRecommended Best Practice
Fiscal Year VariantAprilâ€“MarchJanuaryâ€“DecemberCompany code level â†’ cannot mix within same CoCdâœ… Separate company codes are required
Local GAAPJP GAAPCN GAAPDifferent valuation rules require separate depreciation areasâœ… Create local GAAP depreciation area per CoCd
Controlling Area (CO)Needs FY Aprilâ€“MarchNeeds FY Januaryâ€“DecemberAll CoCds in a CO area must share fiscal year variantâœ… Two controlling areas (one per company code)
Cost Centers / Internal OrdersLocal to CoCd ALocal to CoCd BCO objects cannot span across CO areasâœ… Keep CO objects separate; consolidate at group level
Asset Accounting Fiscal YearBased on CoCd A FYBased on CoCd B FYDepreciation calculated per company codeâœ… No conflict â€” system handles each CoCd independently
Useful Life / APC Changes (FI-AA)January = period 10 (previous fiscal year)January = period 1 (new fiscal year)Changes affect only the specific CoCdâ€™s asset valuesâœ… Safe â€” recalculation in CoCd B does NOT impact CoCd A
Depreciation AreasJP GAAP (Area 01), Group GAAP (Area 10), Tax (Area XX)CN GAAP (Area 01), Group GAAP (Area 10), Tax (Area XX)Depreciation areas independent per CoCdâœ… Use identical structure but different keys/parameters
GL Posting for DepreciationFollows Japan FY periodsFollows China FY periodsPosting logic tied to CoCd FYâœ… No need for alignment; SAP posts separately
Cross-Company IntegrationNot possible for CONot possible for COCO cross-postings require same FYâœ… Perform consolidation using Group Reporting or financial statements
Legal & Localization RequirementsJapan localizationChina localizationLocal specifics are CoCd-specificâœ… Separate CoCds fully comply with local laws


If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Open periods in SAP Group Reporting
entry.content:
HI @cristina_2927 ,

 

TopicSAP Standard BehaviorAvailable OptionsLimitations / Notes
Mass Period OpeningâŒ Not availableNone (standard)Cannot open periods for multiple units at once
Period Opening Methodâœ… Done inside the Data MonitorOpen period per consolidation unit & periodNo global OB52-style function
Open Multiple Periods at OnceâŒ NoMust open each period individuallySAP controls periods at consolidation unit + period level
Open for Multiple Consolidation UnitsâŒ Not directlyâœ… Copy Task Status featureMust first open for one unit, then copy to others
Automation Optionsâœ” Possible with Process Control integrationWorkflow-driven status changesStill unit-by-unit; no true mass opening
Custom DevelopmentOptionalRAP / API for task status updatesNot SAP-standard; requires careful governance
SAP Notes / Documentation PositionConfirms period opening only via Data MonitorNo mass tools providedNo OB52 equivalent in Group Reporting
Recommended Best PracticeUse Data Monitor + Copy Task StatusSimplest and SAP-supported approachMinimizes manual clicks but not full mass opening

entry.title: Re: How to trace original cost document settled through W...
entry.content:
HI @SwapnilKaware ,

 

TopicDetails
Business RequirementBuild a custom report where user inputs Final Asset + Company Code and receives complete trace from Original Cost Document â†’ WBS â†’ AUC â†’ Final Asset
Why Standard Reports Are Not EnoughStandard reports (AR03, AW01N, CJ74, CJ76, CJI3, AIBU) show partial data onlyâ€”no end-to-end linkage from GRN/SES â†’ WBS â†’ AUC â†’ Final Asset in a single report
Settlement Process FlowWBS Costs â†’ AUC (CJ88) â†’ Final Asset (CJ88 with CJIC-defined rules)
Key Tables Neededâ€¢ WBS Costs: ACDOCA, COSS, COSP, RSEG (SES), EKBE (GRN) â€¢ WBS â†’ AUC Settlement: ACDOCA (KOART = 'A', settlement docs), COBRA â€¢ AUC â†’ Final Asset Settlement: ACDOCA (Asset settlement lines), ANLP / ANLC â€¢ Asset Master: ANLA, ANLZ
Primary Linking Logic1. Final Asset â†’ find all settlement docs (ACDOCA) where sender is AUC 2. Identify AUC Asset from same settlement doc lines 3. From AUC, fetch settlement docs where sender is WBS 4. For sender WBS, fetch all original postings (GRN/SES/Invoice) via ACDOCA + EKBE + RSEG
Recommended Custom Report NameZWBS_AUC_FA_TRACE (or ZFA_AUC_WBS_TRACE)
Selection Criteriaâ€¢ Company Code â€¢ Final Asset Number â€¢ Optional: Posting Date Range / Project / AUC
Output Columns (as required)Final Asset â€¢ Final Asset Desc â€¢ AUC Asset â€¢ AUCâ†’FA Settlement Doc â€¢ Posting Date â€¢ Settlement Amount â€¢ WBS Element â€¢ WBS Desc â€¢ WBSâ†’AUC Settlement Doc â€¢ Posting Date â€¢ GRN / SES Doc No â€¢ Posting Date â€¢ PO No â€¢ Vendor
Standard T-Codes Supporting Cross-CheckCJ74 (WBS Line Items), AIBU (Settlement), AW01N (Asset Explorer), CJI3 (WBS actual line items), CJ88 (Settlement)
Feasible Standard AlternativeNo single out-of-the-box SAP report provides a full chain; must be built as a custom CDS view + ALV Fiori report
Recommended Technical Approach (S/4HANA 2022)Build CDS stack: 1. CDS 1: Join Final Asset â†” Settlement Docs (ACDOCA) 2. CDS 2: Join AUC â†” WBS Settlement (ACDOCA + COBRA) 3. CDS 3: Original Cost Docs (ACDOCA + EKBE/RSEG/BKPF/BSEG) 4. CDS 4: Consume above via UNION/ASSOCIATIONS â†’ final composite view 5. Fiori app or custom ALV program for reporting
Performance ConsiderationsUse ACDOCA filters: â€¢ KOART (account type) â€¢ AWREF (asset sub number) â€¢ AWTYP/AWKEY for linking FI â†” MM documents â€¢ OBJNR (WBS) for linking settlement sender
Expected OutcomeA single report that reconstructs the full flow: PO â†’ GRN/SES â†’ WBS â†’ AUC â†’ Final Asset with all financial + logistical traceability

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Delete a mission order
entry.content:
HI @ELOGEALAIN_SAHNGAKOUAKEP ,

 

TopicDetails
Error Message56146 â€“ â€œCancellation not possible because travel data exists for the same period.â€
Cause in CloudMission order overlaps with one or more travel documents (Expense Report, Travel Plan, Approved Trip) for the same employee and period. Cloud enforces strict lifecycle rules, preventing cancellation.
Required Condition for Cancellation- No expense reports submitted- No travel plans exist- No trips approved or posted- No overlapping mission orders for the same period
Common Scenarios Causing Error 561461. Expense report already created/submitted2. Travel plan exists for the period3. Another mission order overlaps4. Trip approved and sent to accounting
Step-by-Step Resolution (Cloud Apps)1. Open â€œMy Travel & Expensesâ€ or Travel Requests app2. Identify all travel documents overlapping with the mission order3. Cancel/Delete expense reports (if in Draft) or Withdraw (if submitted)4. Delete or Withdraw any Travel Plans5. Withdraw any approved trips (if possible)6. Retry mission order cancellation once all dependent documents are cleared
Workflow ReminderCloud enforces: Expense Report Cancellation â†’ Travel Request Withdrawal â†’ Mission Order Cancellation. Direct deletion is not possible.
Tips / Best Practices- Always check overlapping travel documents first- Ensure all status dependencies are cleared before attempting cancellation- Use the â€œTravel Overviewâ€ Fiori app to quickly identify blocking documents

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Error in Posting an Inbound Idoc in In-House Cash
entry.content:
HI @rajeev_uppal2 ,

 

TopicDetails
Error Message / Status56 â€“ â€œPartner Profile does not existâ€
Module / ScenarioSAP In-House Cash (IHC) â€“ IDoc posting / payment processing
MeaningSystem cannot find a partner profile for the IDocâ€™s partner number, message type, and direction. Posting fails without it.
Root Causes1. Missing Partner Profile in WE20 (house bank, bank interface, external system)2. Incorrect Message Type (e.g., IHC_PAYEXT, PAYEXT)3. Wrong direction (inbound vs outbound mismatch)4. Logical system not assigned to partner profile
Resolution Steps1. Check IDoc details (WE02 / WE05) â€“ IDoc number, partner, message type, direction2. Maintain Partner Profile in WE20 â€“ create partner number, assign message type, partner type (LS/KU/LI)3. Ensure correct message type matches IDoc (e.g., IHC_PAYEXT)4. Verify sender/receiver logical system matches BD64 distribution model5. Test IDoc processing (BD87) after maintaining partner profile6. Verify success (IDoc status 53)
Best Practices- Maintain partner profiles in WE20 for all banks/logical systems- Verify message type and direction- Test first IDoc in WE19 before mass processing- Keep logical system names consistent for ALE / IDoc routing- Activate ports in WE21
Common Message Types in SAP IHC- Payment export to house bank / external system â†’ IHC_PAYEXT- Reverse payment / other IHC scenarios â†’ IHCPAYEXT- Bank statement inbound â†’ IHC_BANKSTAT

Divyesh

entry.title: Re: make control obligatory in finding
entry.content:
HI @Lianne_Sorber ,

SAP Audit Management â€“ Mandatory Control Assignment

 

Requirement / ScenarioStandard SupportRecommended ApproachNotes / Comments
Make Control mandatory for all findingsâŒ Not standardUI adaptation (make Control field required)Simple, always-mandatory; cannot be conditional on status
Make Control mandatory based on audit status (e.g., Submit/Close)âŒ Not standardBRF+ validation rule or custom Fiori/UI5 logicConditional enforcement possible using audit status
Enforce mandatory assignment at submission/closureâŒ Not standardBRF+ rule or workflow checkEnsures users cannot submit/close without assigning control
Prevent bypass / enforce strict complianceâŒ Not fully standardCombine UI adaptation + BRF+ validation + workflowProvides strongest enforcement mechanism
Optional workflow-based enforcementPartialApproval workflow can block submission if control missingWorks only during workflow step, not real-time field validation
Notes on BRF+Supports complex conditionsRequires configuration of rule triggered on Save / Submit / CloseCan check status and field value together

entry.title: How can a bank in Kazakhstan register as a provider in SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity?
entry.content:
We are a commercial bank in Kazakhstan planning to integrate with SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity.
Could you please clarify how banks can apply or register to become available providers for corporate clients in SAP MBC?
Any official documentation or onboarding guidance would be appreciated.

entry.title: When using a link model, blank values are replaced with the model ID.
entry.content:
Hello Community,
I want to display two models in a single chart in SAP Analytics Cloud.
To achieve this, I configured linked dimensions in the story and added linked models to the chart.
ãƒ»models

ãƒ»Link Dimensions

ãƒ»Add Linked Models


Then I added items to the chart (table) and displayed them.
Item: While blank data exists in CUSTOMER,
displaying a single model in the table shows (No Value).
However, displaying two models in the table causes alphanumeric characters to appear.


Looking at the displayed alphanumeric characters, it appears that one of the model IDs for the model you are using is shown.

entry.title: 2H 2025 Release Highlights of SAP Best Practices for SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting Management
entry.content:
Dear all,

Hope you are doing fine.

We are excited to share news about the Best Practices package for Recruiting Management 2H 2025 via the upgrade center. We have some new features that help you adopt the latest product enhancements quickly, improve user experience, and make it easy for you to adjust, test, and demo.

Disclaimer: Please note these features are currently available only on preview. The final version will be updated on RTC or production date for 2H 2025.

But before starting, let us share how you can find our Best Practices packages. In the Upgrade Center, filter for SAP Best Practices, and observe that the packages are listed under Recommended Upgrades:

Adopting the Unified Data Model for Career Site Builder

To align with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting product strategy, Best Practices Recruiting packages now adopt the Unified Data Model (UDM) as of release 2511. The UDM standardizes how job data is defined, exposed, and consumed across Recruiting Management and Career Site Builder (CSB), reducing configuration overhead and paving the way for faster innovation.

In Best Practices Recruiting packages, we provide a range of pre-configurations and sample files for you to utilize the Unified Data Model more quickly and easily. The Following are detailed introductions to each configuration point:

Pre-delivered Job Location Long Format

We deliver two sample Job Location Long Formats for US and UK in the Best Practices Recruiting package, you can add more Job Location Long Formats for other countries based on these examples.

Pre-delivered Job Location Short Format

We deliver two sample Job Location Short Formats in the Best Practices Recruiting package, one for the US and one for all other countries.

Additionally, we deliver a business rule to define the condition for triggering the Job Location Short Formats based on the Country selection in the Job Requisition. This rule is assigned to the job requisition template as an Initialize Rule.

Job Location Fields in Job Requisition Template

We add Job Location-related fields and corresponding permissions in the Best Practices pre-delivered Job Requisition Templates: Pipeline Job Requisition, Standard Job Requisition (Integrated with Position Management) (For EC and Onboarding integration), and Standard Job Requisition (for Recruiting standalone). The recruiter can select Job Location when working on a Job Requisition, and the selected Job Location data will be shown in Career Site Builder with the rule-triggered Short Format and country-specific Long Format.

Updated Business Rule for Recruiting and Position Field Mapping

This update is only relevant to the Recruiting Integrated with Position Management scope. In Best Practices Recruiting package, we pre-deliver a busines rule, SFCC_MapReqFields, to automatically retrieve position field values for the job requisition when creating a job requisition from the Position Org Chart. In case the Unified Data Model enabled, we add a field mapping to get Location data from the Position into the Job Location field in the job requisition.

Pre-delivered Sample Job Location and State/Province Data

To support an out-of-the-box process, we deliver sample Job Location data for the US and UK, as well as sample State/Province data. You can use them to run processes directly for your demo or testing. You can also migrate your own location data to the Job Location and State/Province objects.

 

Sample Career Site Builder Import XML

To support the Unified Data Model, we provide a Unified Data Model-enabled sample Career Site Builder XML for you to import. For customers who cannot enable the Unified Data Model due to Career Site Builder server location limitations, you can still use the non-Unified Data Model sample Career Site Builder XML that we provide.

You can get these example XML files from the Configuration File Link on the SAP Best Practices for SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting page in the SAP Help Portal.

Enabled Reimaged Candidate Experience

The Best Practices enable Reimaged Candidate Experience feature, allowing you to adopt a seamless, efficient, and user-friendly application process designed to enhance engagement for both internal and external candidates. All of the Best Practices Recruiting Package Test Scripts have been updated accordingly to reflect the UI changes in the Guided Application Experience, My Applications, and My Profile, each offering Reimaged Candidate Experience features that work together to optimize the candidate journey.

To summarize, these best practices add a lot of value in terms of accelerating your implementations, and we hope to see more adoption from you (partners) in the coming days.  In case you have feedback, please do leave a comment below.

Thank you for your attention.

Best Regards, Tracy

entry.title: ONB Custom Task Workflow and Notification Management
entry.content:
Overview / Business challenges:

The client required multiple custom tasks to be executed like a workflow by different stakeholders as part of the Onboarding process. A simple example is the â€œMedical Checkup processâ€: one stakeholder had to initiate the medical check, another had to review the onboardeeâ€™s submission, and finally, the medical team had to verify the outcome.

In standard SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, custom tasks behave as standalone entities. They are not inherently designed to pass from one stakeholder to another. We ran into two main issues while working on this:

  • Interlinked Task Sequencing â€“ The system doesnâ€™t really allow you to chain custom tasks together. Each one works as a standalone item, so there was no simple way to say â€œonly start Task 2 once Task 1 is done.â€ This broke the idea of a phased workflow and made the process feel disjointed.
  • Targeted Notifications â€“ The standard â€œCustom Task Completion Triggerâ€ sends notifications to every configured recipient each time a task is completed. This quickly became an issue because it meant previously completed tasks were included in the notification again. We needed the email to go only to the next stakeholder in line. Earlier stakeholders shouldnâ€™t get another copy, and each person should only be notified when itâ€™s actually their turn to act.


1. Problem Statement: Interlinked Task Sequencing:

Business Need:

Some activities (like approvals, background checks, or verifications) werenâ€™t meant to stop with one person. They had to move step by step across multiple stakeholders. Each phase was handled by a different owner, but from a business standpoint it was still one activity, not a bunch of unrelated tasks.

Limitation in Standard System:

  1. In SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, custom tasks operate independently and are not linked to each other.
  2. They cannot be inherently connected or â€œawareâ€ of each otherâ€™s progress.
  3. There is no native mechanism to reflect that â€œTask A is completed, now Task B should be assigned.â€

Proposed Solution:

  1. We created a dropdown field called Status on the custom task.
  2. The options â€” Initiated, Completed, Approved, and Rejected â€” were used to show what stage the task was in at any point.
  3. To represent the task in multiple phases, we created separate custom tasks for each stakeholder. All tasks were linked to the same custom MDF base object (with External Code = User), ensuring data continuity across tasks and giving the appearance of an workflow.
  4. This made it appear as if the task was â€œpassingâ€ from one stakeholder to the next, rather than being multiple disconnected tasks.

Configuration:

Creation of Object:

Create the base object for the custom Task as per requirement:


Creation of tasks:

After creating Custom MDF Object definitions, a Custom Task Definition should be created.

As an admin Go to Manage Onboarding and Offboarding Tasks -> Task Setting (Tab) -> Click on New Task under Manage Custom Tasks Section to open "Add a New Custom Task".

Module: Onboarding (as our Task is associated to Onboarding Process)
Custom Task Name: PreEmployment Medical Test
Custom MDF Object: Medical Fitness (cust_MedicalFitness)

        


Click on â€œOpen Template Editorâ€ and make changes as needed:
 

 

Similarly create another custom task with the same base object:

Custom Task Name: PreEmployment Medical Test (Onboardee)
Custom MDF Object: Medical Fitness (cust_MedicalFitness)

 
And another for the medical team:

Custom Task Name: PreEmployment Medical Test- Medical Team
Custom MDF Object: Medical Fitness (cust_MedicalFitness)

 

            

 

NOTE: Basically, we used the same MDF Object, but created different tasks, each for a different stakeholder.

 

Then add the custom tasks to the desired Onboarding Program:


Assign the responsible group against each task as per the requirement.

 

 

 

3. Problem Statement: Targeted Notifications

Business Need:

The client wanted phase-specific notifications. So, once someone finished a task, the next stakeholder should get a notification, that they need to action on the task. Otherwise, people were seeing notifications about tasks they had already done, which was confusing.

Limitation in Standard System:

The standard â€œ(ONB) Custom Task Completion Triggerâ€ doesnâ€™t look at task order or completion status of the task at all. Every time a new task gets completed, it just fires emails for all the old tasks again. That was messy â€” everyone was getting duplicates, and it was hard to figure out what step was actually pending.

Consider the following Medical Test activity which is split into three custom tasks:

  • Medical Test â€“ Initiation (Onboarding Team)
  • Medical Test â€“ Form Submission (Onboardee)
  • Medical Test â€“ Verification (Medical Team)

This is what happens with standard behavior:

  • When the Onboarding Team finishes "Initiation", the Onboardee gets the email, which works fine.
  • When the Onboardee completes "Form Submission", the system fires emails for both "Initiation" and "Form Submission", instead of just notifying the Medical Team.
  • When the Medical Team completes "Verification", the system sends emails for all three tasks again.

The result is a lot of duplicate notifications, and itâ€™s hard for anyone to tell which step is actually pending.


Proposed Solution:

To overcome this limitation:

  1. We added a Status dropdown field to the custom task. This shows what phase the task is in â€” Initiated, Completed by Onboardee, or Completed by Medical Team.
  2. Then we put in business rules so that when someone finishes a task, only the next person in line gets an email. Nobody else gets notified again, and there are no duplicate messages.
  3. Distinct email templates were created for each step, ensuring that each stakeholder receives a clear, context-specific notification at the right time.

With this setup:

  • Once Initiation is completed, only the Onboardee gets the email.
  • After the Onboardee completes their part, the email goes only to the Medical Team.
  • After the Medical Team verifies, the process is over and nothing else gets sent.

This keeps the notifications simple and in order. Everyone only sees what they need to do, no duplicate notifications, no confusion.


Configuration:

Status Field with dropdown value:

Added a custom â€œStatusâ€ dropdown field on the custom task to track the phases â€” Initiated, Completed by Onboardee, Completed by Medical Team.

Example:


NOTE: Custom Tasks do not support picklists. So we had to make a separate MDF object and enter the values manually in Manage Data.

 

Email Templates:

Weâ€™re using the standard email trigger â€œ(ONB) Custom Task Completion Triggerâ€ for sending notifications. But distinct email templates were created for each step, ensuring that each stakeholder receives a clear, context-specific notification at the right time.

For example:

 

 

 

Business Rules to filter Email Template:

And business rules were set up to check the exact phase at completion and trigger only the next phaseâ€™s email.

Scenario: Filter Email Template

Assigned:

 

Assigned:


NOTE: Similar to how the "(ONB) Custom Task Completion Trigger" resends notifications for all previously completed tasks when a new one is finished, the "(ONB) Custom Task Assignment Trigger" behaves in a cumulative way and can generate initiation emails for every stakeholder in workflow sequence.

We made the assignment trigger fire only for the first stakeholder. That way, the assignment email goes out just at the start. After that, all the next emails are handled by the completion trigger. Each stakeholder sees their own phase email only once, no duplicates or extra messages.

entry.content:
@tskwin wrote:

Hi Community,
how can I transport an app (e.g. SAP IAS) from one BTP subaccount to another ?

Thanks for your help.

 

Best Regards

Hello @tskwin,
You can transport SAP IAS configurations using SAP BTP's Transport Management Service (TMS). Set up TMS in both subaccounts, export the app or configuration, and import it into the target subaccount. Make sure both subaccounts are in the same global account and have proper entitlements.


Best Regards,
Jill Muncy

entry.title: Using Embedded SAC to Analyze cross-feature Sales & Service Scenarios
entry.content:
In todayâ€™s data-driven world, businesses need instant access to actionable insights that can guide smarter decisions. For organizations using SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management, the Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) capabilities deliver just thatâ€”enabling seamless, cross-feature analysis directly within your operational systems.

Embedded SAC allows business and admin users to design both simple and complex queries across multiple data sources. Whether youâ€™re analyzing sales performance, service operations, or end-to-end process flows, Embedded SAC helps you visualize and understand your dataâ€”without needing external analytics tools.

Simplify Analytics with Query Designer

At the core of this capability lies the Query Designerâ€”a powerful tool that provides access to all available data sources within your SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management environment.

With Query Designer, you can:

  • Explore master and transactional data sources
  • View how these data sources are pre-joined and delivered out of the box
  • Build custom cross-feature queries tailored to your business needs

SAP provides detailed documentation on how to view and link your data sources through the Query Designer. You can explore it here.

Creating Custom Joins Between Data Sources

Beyond standard joins, admin users can define custom joins between data sources that are not automatically linked. This is achieved using the â€œJoinsâ€ dialog in the Query Designerâ€”accessible from the toolbar or via contextual links within the interface, as illustrated in this video: https://sapvideo.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/?entry_id=1_4njrmc5o

Using this feature, you can connect data sources based on:

  • Primary key fields, or
  • Extension fields that function as keys

For more details on creating Free Joins, refer to SAPâ€™s documentation here.

There are two primary join types available:

  • All Primary Data (Left-Outer Join) â€“ retains all records from the primary dataset
  • Intersecting Data (Inner Join) â€“ includes only records common to both datasets

 Analyzing End-to-End Business Processes

Where this feature truly stands out is in its ability to link data sources along process chainsâ€”enabling comprehensive analysis across parts of the â€œLead to Cashâ€ or â€œService to Cashâ€ flows which are supported within SAP Sales Cloud V2 or SAP Service Cloud V2.

You can achieve this by creating joins between related entities such as:

  • Lead Related Object
  • Opportunity Related Entity
  • Case Related Object

To determine which data sources can be joined, execute these related data sources and review fields such as â€œRelated Entity Typeâ€. This approach helps you map potential joins and build a holistic view of your business processes.

Building Complex Queries for Deep Insights

Once youâ€™ve defined your joins, you can integrate them within the main Query Designer pane to create multi-layered, complex queries. For example, you might design a query that analyzes all related entities of a Leadâ€”offering a complete perspective on how leads progress through your sales pipeline.

The result? A unified, insightful view of your operational data that empowers business leaders to make informed decisions faster, as can been seen in the complex data model below.

Conclusion

With Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud, youâ€™re not just visualizing dataâ€”youâ€™re unlocking a deeper understanding of your business. From standard dashboards to complex process analyses, this powerful embedded capability helps organizations drive agility, efficiency, and growth.

By leveraging the Query Designer and custom join capabilities, CRM administrators and business users alike can transform raw data into meaningful, actionable insightsâ€”directly within the SAP ecosystem.

entry.title: Advice on Payment Term Configuration in OBB8
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts,

I have question on how to achieve these scenarios from OBB8 configuration:

1. Invoice dated 15 August 2025 with document due on 31.10.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Entitle for % discount (Pass)
2. Invoice dated 15 July 2025 with document due on 30.09.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Not entitle for discount (Failed - SAP still showing discount for this document)
3. Invoice dated 15 October 2025 - Shouldn't appear in F110 payment listing (Pass)
 
I have set configuration Payment term Z061:
Term 1: Percentage (1.5%) / Fixed Date (31) / Additional Months (2) - which is failed at 2nd scenario.
 
From my understanding, this vendor only has 1 term.
Due date must always EOM + 2 Months together with discount. If the document is paid after due, no discount should apply at F110.

entry.title: Re: How the Due Date and Reminder determined in task of C...
entry.content: Please feel free to ask further queries here.

entry.title: Re: How the Due Date and Reminder determined in task of C...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

If the settings in the Fine Tuning Activity Business Task Management for Contracts and Customer Returns for the date is set as 60 Days before Contract End Date and the settings in the Reminder field of the Contract is set as 30 Days, then a reminder is sent on 60 days before the Contract End Date as this is the earlier date. However, if these were switched, it would be sent because of what is maintained in the reminder field, as this would be the earlier date.

The data maintained in the Business Configuration activity "Business Task Management for Contracts and Customer Returns" is what is considered always. In this activity, for the Activation Date, if you select the condition "Date and Time for Task Activation" then the Reminder days maintained in the Contract will be used. The system will check the Business Configuration settings when the contract is created or when the contract is renewed. The system will not send a reminder for a contract if nothing had been maintained in the Business Configuration when the contract first started or was last renewed. A change made in the Business Configuration afterwards will not be considered for the contract.

The task is only sent when the Contract Validity is Active.

Regards,

Arjun T H

SAP Product Support

entry.title: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods?
entry.content:
How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods when the wrong period is selected during a depreciation job?

For example, if the job for September has been completed and then the job for November was run directly.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted...
entry.content:
A new time interval needs to be added.

For instance, if an error occurs in November, we can add a new time interval on October 01 2025 in the app "Manage Fixed Assets". Then, adjust the depreciation key to 0000 and run the planned asset accounting job "Depreciation Posting - Period 11." Next, change the depreciation key back to its previous setting, and sequentially run the asset jobs "Depreciation Posting - Period 10" and "Depreciation Posting - Period 11."

3593095 - How to adjust depreciation values to post them into their respective periods after being posted together - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me

entry.title: Access FLP of S/4HANA Rise in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

 

Writing this blog after long analysis. I hope this will help community to fix the issue.

Requirement: Access the Fiori Launchpad of SAP S/4HANA Rise (Private Cloud) in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Analysis: In the Build Work Zone, standard edition site we need to add a new Role which should open the FLP of the S/4HANA system which is Private Cloud. SSO should work between Work Zone and Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA System.

Implementation: Below are the implementation steps in work zone:

1. Add the S/4HANA system in the Cloud Connector with https port

2. Configure the SSO using Principal Propagation so that it wont ask the credentials.

3. Set up the Custom IAS and SSO for Work Zone applicaiton.

4. Create a app, page, space, role in work zone and assing the role to user. PFA the app configuration which will use to connect Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA system. (App configuration for FLP in Work Zone.jpg)

Error: Once all the configuration in placed, we will access the FLP in the work zone and below error will come. PFA the error screenshot (Error when accessing FLP in Work Zone.jpgğŸ˜

Error

App could not be opened either due to an incorrect SAP Fiori launchpad configuration or a missing role assignment.

Solution: After lot of analysis not found any blog for this solution and finally found the solution by uncheck the property in the work zone app "Add intent and default SAP parameters to URL" and save. PFA the screen shot for same ()

After saving, access the FLP again and it open the Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA On Premise. PFA the working scenario (FLP of S4HANA working in Work Zone.jpg)

Please let me know your feedback if someone is able to fix the issue or having any other issue while configuriing the same.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Re: Employee Central IBAN bank validation
entry.content:
Hi @Mikkelsen ,

The business rules framework unfortunately causes precision loss when converting a very large number of Java type Long. Long is used internally in the business rules framework when you use the "To Number()" function with the incoming String containing a large number. As a workaround, you can concatenate a ".0" to the String containing the large number. In this case, a decimal number will be generated by the "To Number()" function instead of a Long. As a result, no conversion is needed when you use for example the rule function "Modulo()" for this number.

entry.title: Re: Employee Central IBAN bank validation
entry.content:
Hi @Mikkelsen ,

Unfortunately, the business rules cause precision loss if a very large number of Java type Long is converted. The Java type Long is used as the output of the rule function "To Number()" if the input is a String containing a very large number without decimal point. As a workaround, you can concatenate a ".0" to the String. In this case, "To Number()" returns a decimal type and no conversion is needed if you use this number for a rule function like "Modulo()".

entry.title: Re: Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience
entry.content:
Just to clarify, this upgrade is not optional. It will be deployed to all tenants during the next productive upgrade, which is about a week from now.
Once the upgrade is applied, sending cases to SAP will only be possible through the new Built-In Support. All references to â€œSend to Providerâ€ will be removed from the legacy tool.

The first version of the legacy Built-In Support will still remain visible under Administrator â†’ Cases. End users will still be able to create internal tickets there, and key users will still be able to support their end users.
However, creating cases to send to SAP will be exclusively available in the new Built-In Support.

Also, with this change, internal tickets and SAP tickets will be fully separated. Internal tickets remain in the legacy view, while SAP cases must be created and managed in the new Built-In Support.
